moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nc3 Nc6 3. Nge2 d6 4. g3 g6: Here is where I realized I might have a king-side attack and I became excited about the possibility that I might win.
moves.29... Rcf8: Here he reacts to my move which is indication that I had a real threat going.
moves.30. Rf2: I enjoyed this move because it attacked his knight and furthered my king-side build-up.
moves.30... Na4 31. h4 Nc3 32. Rbf1: Here is where I went for broke. I believed that passive defence would definitely loose so I staked everything on this attack. Ultimately I lost but it sure made the game exciting.
I thought he was going to do this and I think this pretty much breaks my attack. (Which indicates it wasn't sound - but at least it was fun.)
moves.36. g6 Rxf4: Now he threatens to checkmate me. (He's a really good player.)
